isis.stitle: FE 300 BUS BODY COMPONENTS - Body Accessories and Miscellaneous - Headlight Adjustment and/or Replace

note.para: Some vehicles may be equipped with additional accessory lights which are not covered in this section.

svcprocinfo.para: When diagnosing light failures, first check for a blown fuse or tripped circuit breaker. If a blown fuse or tripped circuit breaker is found, inspect wiring circuit for cause of overload and make necessary repairs.
If the fuse or circuit breaker is satisfactory, check for burned out light bulb and replace if necessary. Refer to LIGHT BULB CHART for proper bulb replacement.
If light bulb is good check wiring connectors for an open circuit. A 12 volt test light can be used to check circuit continuity. Refer to appropriate wiring circuit diagram.

svcsubproc.title: Headlight Aiming
svcsubproc.para: Various types of headlight aiming equipment are available commercially. When using aiming equipment follow the instructions provides by the equipment manufacturer.

step1.para: Where headlight aiming equipment is not available, headlights aiming can be checked by projecting the upper beam of each light on a screen or chart at a distance of about 25 feet ahead of the headlights. The bus should be exactly perpendicular to the chart.
The vertical lines on the chart ( Figure 220) mark the distance between the vertical center lines of the headlights and are equally spaced from the center line of the chart.

para.emph: Headlight aim should always be checked on a level floor with the vehicle unloaded.
In some states, the above instructions may conflict with existing laws and regulations. Where this is the case, legal requirements must be met. Modify instructions accordingly.

step1.para: A horizontal should be placed on the chart at a level of two inches below the height of the headlight centers above the floor.
With the headlight beams on high beam, the hot spot of each projected beam pattern should be centered over the intersection of the vertical and horizontal lines on the chart ( Figure 20).
If necessary, adjust headlights vertically and/or laterally to obtain proper aim. Refer to Headlight Adjustment in this section.

svcsubproc.title: Headlight Adjustments
svcsubproc.para: Adjusting screws are provided to move the headlight assembly in relation to the bus body front end to obtain correct headlight aim.

step1.para: Lateral or side to side adjustment is accomplished by turning the adjusting screw at the side of the headlight ( Figure 221, Item 2).
Vertical or up-and-down adjustment is accomplished by turning the adjusting screw at the top of the headlight ( Figure 221, Item 1).
To adjust headlight aim, turn the adjusting screws as required to position the headlight beam pattern as shown under Headlight Aiming.
Adjustments can be made without removing headlight bezels.
Remove screws that secure turn signal light assembly from the light pod.
Gently pull turn signal light assembly from light pod and place to the side.
Remove screws that secure headlight bezel and remove bezel.
Remove headlight retaining ring screws and retaining ring ( Figure 223, Item 1).
Disconnect retaining spring (Item 2).
Pull sealed beam out and disconnect connector ( Figure 224, Item 3).
Discard or recycle old sealed beam as required.
Locate replacement sealed beam and connect the three way wiring connector to the new sealed beam plug.
Position sealed beam in retaining ring, connect retention spring and install into mounting bracket.
Install retaining ring screws and tighten.
Install headlight bezel and screws. Tighten screws.
Position turn signal light assembly into light pod, install screws and tighten.
Check light operation.
Check headlight aim. Refer to Headlight Aiming section.

svcsubproc.title: Headlight Assembly Replacement
svcsubproc.para: If the headlight assembly needs to be replaced due to damage or broken components use the following procedure to remove and replace headlight assembly.

figure.caption: Figure 225. Adjusting Screw Mounting Details (A is Front View and B is Top View)

step1.para: Remove screws that secure turn signal lens assembly ( Figure 222, Item 1).
Gently pull turn signal lens assembly from light pod and place aside ( Figure 227, Item 4.
Remove screws that secure headlight bezel and remove bezel.
Disconnect headlight retaining spring from headlight assembly ( Figure 226, Item 4).
Disengage headlight assembly from adjustment screws. DO NOT TURN ADJUSTMENT SCREWS.
Disconnect three way wiring connector from rear of sealed beam unit and remove headlight assembly.
To remove sealed beam assembly from mounting ring (if necessary):

step2.para: Remove three retaining screws and remove sealed beam retaining ring.
Remove sealed beam unit from mounting ring.

step1.para: If replacement of headlight retaining spring is required:

step2.para: Remove spring retaining screw and remove spring from inner skin.
Position new spring on inner skin and secure with retaining screw.

step1.para: If required, replace headlight adjusting screw(s) as follows:

step2.para: While pushing screw inward (toward rear of vehicle) rotate grommet (nut) ninety degrees clockwise ( Figure 225, Item 1).

svcsubproc.title: Front Parking / Turn Signals- Bulb Replacement
svcsubproc.para: Follow procedure to remove and replace burned out parking light or directional light bulb:

step1.para: Remove screws that secure turn signal lens assembly.
Gently pull turn signal lens from light pod.
Remove light socket from turn signal lens assembly.
Remove bulb from socket.
Install new bulb in socket.
Install light socket into turn signal assembly.
Position light assembly into light pod and install screws
Check light operation.
Remove screws that secure light assembly to body light pod.
Gently pull light assembly from light pod ( Figure 227, Item 4)
Disconnect light assembly from turn signal connector ( Figure 227 Item 2).
Attach new light assembly to connector. Install retaining screw
Position light assembly into light pod and install screws. Tighten until snug.
Check light operation.
